q: `` When somebody gets 49 points in the first three quarters obviously its going to draw attention to the other team,'' said Allen Iverson , whose career high of 60 came against Orlando on Feb. 12, 2005. When somebody's got 49 points they want to make sure I get the ball out of my hands, and that's what they did. My responsibly is to give it up and my teammates had to make plays. They couldn't. Carmelo Anthony was 4-for-10 from the field in the fourth and the rest of the team made 3 of 9. While Allen Iverson got cold, Kobe Bryant heated up. Kobe Bryant picked up his fourth foul 38

They presumed the United States now could cut its military budget dramatically and spend that money at home. That perception was bolstered two years later when Colin Powell , then chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, declared: I'm running out of enemies. I'm down to Castro and Kim Il Sung . Colin Powell 's observation 20 years ago is still basically true: The United States has no militarily significant rivals, notwithstanding the terrorist threat and the war in Afghanistan. Eagles' Michael Vick , Ben Roethlisberger might be the toughest quarterback to sack, said Jets defensive end Shaun Ellis.`` He's very strong. He's very elusive in the pocket,'' Ellis said. A lot of people don't realize how fast he is.... I know he looks slow moving around on the field, but he's pretty nifty at what he does.
